result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy Lynn Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations. Enroll within 60 days.

Must complete any programming or treatment required by agent.

Must follow through with any mental health regimen.

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy Lynn Nelson

records.addlTxt:
10:46 AM Defendant Amy Lynn Nelson in court.  Attorney Derek W Sanders in court for Amy Lynn Nelson. Attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. On count 2- def- G plea. CT accepts plea, adj G. Count 1 and 3 RI&D on state's motion. Arguments. 

SENTENCE: W/held 1 year probation. 3 days credit. Must report to probation today. AODA and comply. Any other treatment or programming required by agent. Follow through with any mental health regimen. $265.60 fine/costs, $200 DNA surcharge and sample. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC. FTP- judgment. 10:54 am adj.

11:31 AM. JL-Clerk. Defendant Amy Lynn Nelson in court.  Attorney Derek W Sanders in court for Amy Lynn Nelson.  Attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp in court for State of Wisconsin. Def waives PH. CT accepts waiver. CT finds PC, Def bound over for trial. ARGN: Reading waived, plea NG. Defense is preserved 15 days on prearraignment rights. Bond cont. 11:34 am adj.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Qualifies. WSPH. 1:14 pm adj.
